definition: deficiency/deficit/luckily/it's lucky that.../(often ironically) fancy that...
to decrease/to lose/to damage/to harm/(coll.) to speak sarcastically/to deride/caustic/mean/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷨)

sentences.english: Killing the slaver overseer no longer results in karma loss.
sentences.chinese: 殺死口水監督員在業虧損不再結果。
預見到會有虧損，雍容大度地接受虧損。
預見到會有虧損，雍容大度地接受虧損。

sentences.english: They may be worried about Vladimir Putin, but they are more worried about cutting their losses.
sentences.chinese: 以前他們把寶押在普京身上，現在他們更關注虧損了。

sentences.english: Excluding the effects of one-time gains, operating losses were pared 32 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 扣除一次性收益影響，該業務營運虧損縮減32%。

sentences.english: Management of the firm culpable for its losses will be terminated.
sentences.chinese: 對公司虧損負有責任的管理層將被撤職。

sentences.english: Losses of the PBC shall be setoff by allocations of the central finance.
sentences.chinese: 中國人民銀行的虧損由中央財政撥款彌補。

sentences.english: The trust group will not bear loss of the entrusted company.
sentences.chinese: 託管組不承擔被託管證券公司的虧損。

sentences.english: Operational and policy-related losses are common phenomena existing in metro companies.
sentences.chinese: 地鐵企業普遍存在着行業性的政策性虧損。

sentences.english: They were allowed to sell lossmaking lines to new short-haul railroads.
sentences.chinese: 他們可以自由出售虧損線路給短途鐵路運輸公司。

sentences.english: The results show that there are two kinds of net gain losses.
sentences.chinese: 結果表明級聯繫統存在着淨增益虧損。

sentences.english: In fact, Turtles could have had a string of losers in a row with multiple false breakouts .
sentences.chinese: 實際上，海龜們會因爲假突破而形成一連串的虧損。

sentences.english: And, sooner or later, spending will have to be restrained to reduce the balance of payments deficit.
sentences.chinese: 同時，遲早的事情，消費將受到抑止以減少支付虧損。

sentences.english: The company's net loss widened marginally to 25.5 billion yen.
sentences.chinese: 該公司淨虧損小幅擴大到255億日圓。

sentences.english: You have to accept the uncertainty of the markets and be ready to take a small loss without quibbling .
sentences.chinese: 你還要接受市場的不確定性，不找藉口地接受小虧損。

sentences.english: That was nearly three-quarters of the losses made by all Indian carriers combined.
sentences.chinese: 這幾乎是印度所有航空公司虧損總額的四分之三。

definition: achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
financial year/fiscal year (e.g. from April to March, for tax purposes)
expenditures/expenses/CL:筆|笔[bi3], 項|项[xiang4]/to spend money/(coll.) to pay wages
